utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Look at this. Elon Musk has a theory that we’re all just characters in some advanced civilization’s video game.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: So some alien kid spent his money on the asthma-and-glasses upgrade for me?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, he doesn’t say it’s a good game.

utterance.speaker: Howard (entering)
utterance.content: All right, we got a problem.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What’s up?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: The Air Force contacted me about our quantum gyroscope. They want to have a meeting.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Yeah. This military guy showed up at Howard’s door. He was terrifying.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, what did he say?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: He gave me his business card and asked me to please pass it along to Howard.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: That doesn’t sound terrifying.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: To a white guy born here, no. If you are a brown guy whose name has a lot of syllables in it, terrifying.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You realize if the military declares our research classified, they can take the whole thing away from us.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: And if that happens, we’ll never be able to sell it commercially.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: There goes our big payday.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I was counting on that money. I need to make as much as my wife so I don’t have to try so hard in bed.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You do that, too?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Oh, yeah. How do you think I stay this thin?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Gentlemen, I think we are losing sight of the real issue. We are on the precipice of becoming faceless cogs in the military-industrial complex. Isn’t that exciting?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Well, you’re kidding, right?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Not at all. In Star Wars, when the stormtroopers would march in perfect formation, harassing civilians, didn’t you ever think, hey, that could be me?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Sheldon, we could be contributing to a weapons system that oppresses mankind for the next thousand years.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Okay, Howard’s on board. What do you think, Leonard?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: I’m worried about Howard. Ever since that guy from the Air Force showed up, he’s been a nervous wreck.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: All right, we work at a giant pharmaceutical company. Get him some anti-anxiety meds.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: He won’t take any pills that aren’t chewable and shaped like a Flintstone.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You know, when Leonard’s feeling anxious I make him take a long walk.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Does that help?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, for a while. Then he comes back.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: I don’t believe this.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: What’s wrong?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: This guy from the office just congratulated me on being pregnant.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: You did already know, right?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: No one at the office did. Did you tell anyone?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: No. You told me not to.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: I bet it was Barbara Chen in retrovirus. She might have heard me throwing up one morning. Every since she got the hearing aid, she thinks she’s so great.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Why don’t you want anyone to know?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: ‘Cause I’m up for a major immunotherapy study, and if they find out I’m pregnant they might give it to someone else.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Would they really do that?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: I know they would, they did it to Barbara Chen last year when I told everyone she was pregnant.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Wail till I Snapchat that my friends might be working on a top secret government project.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Are you crazy? You can’t put that on Snapchat.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Fine, I’ll put it on Facebook like a caveman.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You know, maybe before our meeting we should talk to a lawyer.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: That’s not a bad idea.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Well, you must have someone in your family that’s a lawyer.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Why? Because I’m Jewish? That’s like me saying, hey, you’re Indian, doesn’t your cousin work in a call centre?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: My cousin does work in a call centre.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: And my cousin’s a lawyer.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: We don’t need Howard’s cousin. No, we have me.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You’re not a lawyer, Sheldon, you’re just a know-it-all.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I am not a know-it-all. I’m a person who knows lots of things and likes to correct other people when they’re wrong.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: That’s the definition of being a know-it-all.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Or in German, a Besserwisser.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: How did you think you were gonna hide your pregnancy?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: I had a plan. I kept leaving Dove Bar wrappers around to explain any weight gain.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Where did you get empty Dove Bar wrappers?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: From all the Dove Bars I ate. I’m pregnant. Try to keep up. I’m sorry, I have to go find out if my boss knows.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Well, whatever happens, we’re here for you.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Thanks. You guys are the best.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah, drive safe. We love you. And give us a call… Oh, my God, it was me, it was me. I’m the one who blabbed she was pregnant!

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I didn’t mean to. It just slipped out in front of her assistantone day. I…

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: I forgot my coat.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, here’s your coat, honey. That’s such a cute jacket. Oh God, I feel so bad, I just lied to her.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Oh, but you did it so well. That’s amazing, it’s like watching a sculptor, but your clay was lies.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Is that really what’s important right now?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I mean, seriously, you have got to let me scan your brain when you’re being dishonest so I can see what lights up.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: That’s super helpful, Amy. Thanks a lot. I can’t wait to do that.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I can see a clump of bitch cells lightin’ up from here.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Give me a second to call my cousin.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I don’t see how a tax lawyer from Fort Lauderdale could be helpful regarding intellectual property.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: First of all, he’s in Boca Raton, which is better than Fort Lauderdale. But more importantly, he lasted two days on Jeopardy, so he’s clearly a smart guy.

utterance.speaker: Howard’s cousin (on skype)
utterance.content: Hello.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Hey, Marty. Thanks for talking to us.

utterance.speaker: Marty
utterance.content: Hey, no problem. Thanks for going to outer space so no matter what I do my mom will be disappointed in me.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Well, I married a little Catholic girl, so we’re even. Anyway, this is Leonard and Sheldon. The three of us came up with the guidance system.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Hello.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: And this is my friend, Raj.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Oh, I’m not on the patent. I’m just here because there’s a bumblebee in my office.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I saw it. It’s big.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Anyway, like I said in the e-mail, this meeting’s on Thursday. Do you have any advice for us?

utterance.speaker: Marty
utterance.content: Well, I don’t know much about patent law. But, uh, my advice is hear them out, offer as little information as possible, and whatever you do, don’t sign anything.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Don’t sign anything? That’s your advice? Okay, so, uh, if during this meeting, one of us were to, say, complete an oil painting, you’d recommend that we leave that unsigned?

utterance.speaker: Marty
utterance.content: That’s not what I meant.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: That’s what you said.

utterance.speaker: Marty
utterance.content: That’s not what I meant.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: This must be how you practice law in Boca Raton, by saying things you don’t mean and meaning things you don’t say.

utterance.speaker: Marty
utterance.content: Howard, why is he yelling at me?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: All right, you were on Jeopardy. Allow me to Alex Trebek this and put it in the form of a question: Who has been a complete waste of our time?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Marty, let me call you back.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Someday, when I’m up on murder charges, you’ll be hearing from me.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You don’t need him. I’ll represent you.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Hey. What brings you by?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, had to go to a sales seminar on our new sleeping pill.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Oh. How was it?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Great.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Fell asleep?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: In, like, two minutes. Yeah. So, how is everything going around here? Are you still upset about people finding out you’re pregnant?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: I’m furious.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Sure, sure. Uh, did you ever figure out who told?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: No. I confronted Barbara Chen, but she claimed she didn’t know what I was talking about.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Hmm. Well, I guess it’s just gonna remain a mystery, you know, like whatever happened in that seminar after they dimmed the lights.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: It had to be Barbara. I’ve been trying to figure out a way to get back at her. Do you think using her work computer to Google how to be a prostitute is over the line?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Uh, you know, when I was in high school, there was this girl who was talking about me behind my back, so me and all my friends, we cornered her in the bathroom and forgave her.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: What kind of revenge is that? This woman screwed with my job. She’s got to pay.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, all right, honey, you know what? There was something I was too scared to tell you yesterday, and now I’m just balls-out terrified to tell you, but the truth is it wasn’t Barbara Chen, it was me. I’m the reason everyone knows.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Why did you do that?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, it was an accident.I am so sorry I lied.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Get out.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, you know, I also lied about the girl in the bathroom. Yeah, we actually dumped her retainer in the toilet and put it back in her mouth.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I don’t understand why I can’t talk at this meeting.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: ‘Cause when you talk, it enrages people.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Okay. Quick question. Am I allowed to exchange pleasantries upon meeting this colonel?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Am I allowed to inform him that Colonel Sanders was never actually in the military?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I’m getting enraged.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Fine. Ooh. Can I use text-to-speech software?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Don’t speak.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon’s phone
utterance.content: Aw, nuts.

utterance.speaker: Colonel Williams
utterance.content: Gentlemen, I’m Colonel Williams. Thank you for meeting with me.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Hello.

utterance.speaker: Colonel Williams
utterance.content: So, which one of you is the brains behind all this?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: It’s a group effort, but I guess if we had to pick a main brain, it would be me.

utterance.speaker: Colonel Williams
utterance.content: And because of the quantum vortices, this can run perpetually?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Exactly. Yeah, you have a good grasp of the physics.

utterance.speaker: Colonel Williams
utterance.content: Well, I’m a scientist by training.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Really? You’re a physicist?

utterance.speaker: Colonel Williams
utterance.content: Better. I’m an engineer.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Where did you go to school?

utterance.speaker: Colonel Williams
utterance.content: MIT.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Oh. Well, hey, me, too.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Well, thanks, but you should know we’re a little concerned about this being used in weapons.

utterance.speaker: Colonel Williams
utterance.content: Oh, well, let me put your mind at ease. What we use it for is none of your business.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I don’t know how I feel about this.

utterance.speaker: Colonel Williams
utterance.content: Look, guys, it’s just a guidance system. It’s not like you’re handing us the Death Star from Star Trek. All you need to worry about is, right now, it’s this big, and we need it to be this big.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: That’s a lot less big.

utterance.speaker: Colonel Williams
utterance.content: Yes, it’s this much less big.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I’m not even sure that’s possible.

utterance.speaker: Colonel Williams
utterance.content: Well, I ran it by some colleagues at MIT, and they thought they could get it done in four months.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Four months?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yeah, we’ll do it in two. Hi. I’m Dr. Sheldon Cooper. I’m the actual brains behind this project. Also, engineers aren’t real scientists, MIT’s a trade school, and the Death Star is from Star Wars, not Star Trek. But otherwise, thank you for your service.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Hi. Howard told me you were working late, so I brought dinner.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Oh, thanks. You know, I just wanted to get some work done without people congratulating me about the baby every five minutes.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I spent my day alone in the lab waiting for a rat to die of anthrax.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Did you come here to bring me dinner or to gloat?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Well, I came to see how you were feeling, but I’m guessing still angry?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: I’m sorry. My boss wants to meet with me, and I’m stressing.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: You really think they’re gonna start treating you differently?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Are you kidding? I’ve always been treated differently. Look at me. Listen to me. I mean, the first thought when you see me isn’t that’s a scientist, it’s I wonder if her mommy

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I am really regretting that I got you a Happy Meal.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: I’ve worked so hard to get where I am, and I don’t want to get sent back to square one because I’m pregnant.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I understand how you feel.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I wish there were some way I could make it better.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Well, you brought me French fries. That’s a start.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Uh, actually, I got you apple slices ’cause you’re pregnant.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Apple slices? What kind of lunatic goes to McDonald’s and gets fruit?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I’ll be right back.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: And a chocolate shake.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Hello.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What are you doing?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, Leonard’s mad at me, so I’m making him lemon bars.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Does he even like lemon bars?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Not really. But I’m mad at him, too, so lemon bars it is.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Something happen at the meeting?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: They made me promise I wouldn’t talk.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: And you talked?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, now, see? You knew what was gonna happen. Why didn’t they? Anyway, now we’re committed to completing this project in a ridiculously short time frame, and everyone’s upset with me.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, if it makes you feel any better, Bernadette’s mad at me, too.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Mm. If it makes you feel any better, a parasitoid wasp known as Oobius depressus has been rediscovered after 101 years of presumed extinction.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Why would that make me feel better?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Why would your Bernadette thing make me feel better? At least mine was educational.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay. Never mind.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Look, I’m sorry. Tell me why Bernadette is upset with you.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, I told people at work that she’s pregnant. She wasn’t ready for them to know.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Why would you do that?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, it just slipped out. I feel terrible.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: See, that’s exactly what happened to me, except that I said it on purpose, and I have no regrets.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Is it even possible to get this done in two months?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Well, maybe. I don’t know. We’ll have to work 12 hours a day, seven days a week.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Which means I won’t be able to make Penny breakfast every day, and she’ll realize my brioche French toast was the only thing keeping her in the marriage.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I love your French toast.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, thanks, man.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: So, why did you guys even agree to the deadline?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: We didn’t. Sheldon did.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: And you just let him?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Well, the colonel said it was for the good of the country, and the funding is substantial.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: No, but mostly, there was an awkward pause, and I broke it by saying okay.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: So I guess I won’t be seeing you guys for a while.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, looks like it.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Wow. You’re going off to work with the military, leaving me behind. Now I know how all those army wives feel.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Would you stop? We’re just gonna be on the other side of campus.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: And right here.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You are a deeply silly man.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: He is so afraid of his feelings.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, hi.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Got a minute?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah, come on in.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: I just wanted to apologize. I know what you did was an accident.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, thank you, and I’m sorry I lied about it.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: For what it’s worth, you’re a great liar.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, that’s what Amy said. So what’s going on with the research project? Are they gonna let you run it?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Well, my boss said he hadn’t decided yet, so I gently reminded him that he’s an old rich white guy, and I’m a sweet little pregnant lady who’s not afraid to crying front of a jury.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You threatened to sue?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Hey, I learned a long time ago, when you’re four feet eleven and eye level with every guy’s crotch, that’s where you punch.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: That’s funny. I learned something totally different.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Do you know what? It’s just a research project. The most important job in the world is gonna be raising this child. It’s all I need to give my life meaning.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, that’s so beautiful.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: You believe me? Oh, good. 11 more chumps like you, I’ll have the jury eating out of my hand.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I never realized this building was classified.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Maybe that’s because it’s classified.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Wish we weren’t so far from my parking space.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: The way you put away those lemon bars, perhaps that’s a good thing.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I’d like to reinstate the you-not-talking rule.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Why? It clearly doesn’t work.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I guess this is it.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Is that a retinal scanner?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Let’s find out.

utterance.speaker: Scanner
utterance.content: Howard Wolowitz, access granted.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No way.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Impressive.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, my turn, my turn.

utterance.speaker: Scanner
utterance.content: Leonard Hofstadter, access granted.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I didn’t even have to take my glasses off/

utterance.speaker: Scanner (as Leonard and Sheldon try to fool it with one eye each)
utterance.content: Access denied.

utterance.speaker: Leonard and Sheldon
utterance.content: It knows.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Oh, oh, oh, oh, guys, hold me upside down.

utterance.speaker: Scanner
utterance.content: Howard Wolowitz, access granted.

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: Yay.
